story.name: 6df9e782-9752-4e71-8d08-806a42bb341b
story.title: Brits to skipper from back row as S.Africa change 13
story.summary: South Africa sprang a surprise Wednesday by picking veteran hooker Schalk Brits to captain their side in the Pool B game against minnows Namibia, but from the unfamiliar position of No 8.The Springboks changed all but two of their team for Saturday's clash of the southern African neighbours in Toyota City as they rotated their squad after a tough opening defeat against New Zealand.Brits, 38, will deputise as captain for the benched Siya Kolisi, becoming the second-oldest Springbok to appear...

xmlText.p: South Africa sprang a surprise Wednesday by picking veteran hooker Schalk Brits to captain their side in the Pool B game against minnows Namibia, but from the unfamiliar position of No 8.
The Springboks changed all but two of their team for Saturday's clash of the southern African neighbours in Toyota City as they rotated their squad after a tough opening defeat against New Zealand.
Brits, 38, will deputise as captain for the benched Siya Kolisi, becoming the second-oldest Springbok to appear at a World Cup after Victor Matfield.
Only outside centre Lukhanyo Am and wing Makazole Mapimpi keep their places after Saturday's 23-13 loss to the defending champions.
Herschel Jantjies and Elton Jantjies make up a namesake halves pairing while the likes of Steven Kitshoff, Eben Etzebeth and Cheslin Kolbe join Kolisi on a high-quality bench.

Warrick Gelant; S'Busiso Nkosi, Lukhanyo Am, Frans Steyn, Makazole Mapimpi; Elton Jantjies, Herschel Jantjies; Schalk Brits (capt), Kwagga Smith, Francois Louw; Lood de Jager, RG Snyman; Vincent Koch, Mbongeni Mbonambi, Tendai Mtawarira
Replacements: Steven Kitshoff, Thomas du Toit, Eben Etzebeth, Siya Kolisi, Franco Mostert, Cobus Reinach, Damian de Allende, Cheslin Kolbe
